name: Global Health Foundation
question: Which disease has been nearly eradicated thanks to global vaccination efforts?
description: The Global Health Foundation supports vaccination programs that help eradicate diseases worldwide.
fact: Did you know? Polio has been present for thousands of years, with the first known description dating back to 1789.

name: Green Earth Initiative
question: What percentage of the Earth’s surface is covered by forests?
description: Green Earth Initiative works to protect forests and promote sustainability for a greener planet.
fact: Did you know? Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and store it in their wood, leaves, and soil, making forests powerful carbon sinks. A single mature tree can absorb up to 150 kilograms of carbon dioxide per year.

name: Ocean Protectors
question: Which underwater ecosystem is often called the 'rainforest of the sea' due to its incredible biodiversity?
description: Ocean Protectors safeguards marine ecosystems and educates about ocean conservation.
fact: Did you know? Coral polyps, the tiny animals that build reefs, are closely related to jellyfish.

name: Feed the Future
question: Approximately how many people worldwide suffer from hunger daily?
description: Feed the Future fights hunger by providing meals and sustainable food solutions globally.
fact: Did you know? The world produces enough food to feed everyone, yet millions still go hungry.

name: Water for All
question: What percentage of the world’s population lacks access to safe drinking water?
description: Water for All provides clean and safe drinking water to communities in need around the world.
fact: Did you know? Lack of access to clean water causes more deaths each year than all forms of violence, including war.

name: Books Beyond Borders
question: Which region has the highest rate of youth illiteracy in the world?
description: Books Beyond Borders improves literacy by distributing books and building libraries in underserved areas.
fact: Did you know? Over 770 million adults worldwide cannot read or write, and two-thirds of them are women.

name: Shelter First
question: What is considered the leading cause of homelessness in the United States?
description: Shelter First provides emergency housing and long-term shelter solutions for people experiencing homelessness.
fact: Did you know? A single night's stay in an emergency shelter can save a life, especially during winter months.

name: Paws & Peace
question: Roughly how many stray dogs and cats enter U.S. shelters each year?
description: Paws & Peace rescues stray animals, promotes spaying/neutering, and advocates for animal welfare.
fact: Did you know? Adoption saves two lives — the pet you take home and the one who gets a space in the shelter.

name: Solar Hope
question: What renewable energy source is the most abundant on Earth?
description: Solar Hope brings clean solar energy to off-grid schools, clinics, and homes in developing regions.
fact: Did you know? The sun provides more energy to Earth in one hour than the world uses in a year.

name: Voices for Wildlife
question: Which species is currently considered critically endangered?
description: Voices for Wildlife protects endangered species through conservation programs and public advocacy.
fact: Did you know? Fewer than 100 Amur leopards remain in the wild, making them one of the rarest big cats on Earth.

name: Equal Tech
question: What is the term for the gap between those who have access to technology and those who don’t?
description: Equal Tech provides laptops, internet, and training to underrepresented communities and students.
fact: Did you know? Over 40% of the global population still lacks access to the internet.

name: Mind Matters
question: What is the most common mental health disorder in the world?
description: Mind Matters expands access to mental health care and raises awareness to reduce stigma.
fact: Did you know? Anxiety disorders affect an estimated 284 million people globally.
